organization.description: The Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer (FLC) is the nationwide network of federal laboratories that provides the forum to develop strategies and opportunities for linking laboratory mission technologies and expertise with the marketplace.
organization.title: Federal Laboratory Consortium
organization.name: federal-laboratory-consortium

name: automated-scanning-electron-microscope
notes: The ASPEX Personal SEM (PSEM) is a tungsten filament scanning electron microscope optimized for automated particle analysis. The system was designed with staging, scan control and detector geometries optimized for sizing and measuring the composition of particles in the 0.5 micrometer to 100 micrometer range. The PSEM is capable of ~1,000 particles per hour throughput when collecting both size and compositional data and ~10,000 particles per hour when collecting only sizing data. The resulting data sets can be mined for population statistics or needle-in-the-haystack type analyses.  Specifications / Capabilities:  * Imaging:  Down to sub-micron sized features  Secondary Electron Detection  Backscattered Electron Detection (Composition/Topographic modes)  * X-ray Microanalysis:  30 mm2 SDD capable of &gt;20,000 cps on Cu at 1 nA  Standards-based quantification  * Automated Analysis:  0.5 to 100 micrometer particles  Best for Z&gt;12 on carbon substrates  1,000 particles per hour (Composition+Sizing)  10,000 particles per hour (Sizing only)  * Sample types (common):  GSR Prep (sticky carbon on &#189;&quot; pin mount)  Dispersion on pyrolytic carbon planchet  Other  Scientific Opportunities / Applications:  * Environmental (air/water/surface)  * Industrial Quality Control  * Forensic
title: Automated Scanning Electron Microscope
